tr.td: Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes)

value.displayName: CONCUSSION WITH BRIEF LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS

translation.displayName: Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes)

code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:white female aged 37 ys presents via EMS a short time following MVA. she was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the back of the head (LOC 45 min). Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 25 mph on impact. pt c/o mild vomiting, moderate nausea, severe headache and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 160 cm, Weight 93.4 kg, Temperature 36.6 C, Pulse 76, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 17, MRI Brain Unremarkable, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:37 YO female returns for f/u approx. one (1) week s/p concussion with LOC 45 min. denies headache, vomiting and nausea. First 24-hour hourly checks were without incident. Denies ever using tobacco describes drinking an average of 12 drinks a week for about 8 days in her past o:Height 161 cm, Weight 94 kg, Temperature 36.6 C, Pulse 77, SystolicBP 114, DiastolicBP 75, Respiration 18, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=98,Visual Memory=96,Processing Speed=46.1,Reaction Time=0.46, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.
